intro: Brighamia insignis f. citrina, commonly known as the Citrine Brighamia, is a rare and striking plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers, which contrast beautifully with its green, fleshy leaves. The plant is a succulent, adapted to the dry, coastal conditions of its native habitat. Its unique coloration makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and among plant enthusiasts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
